title: 'Reset, avoid on-field battles': AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice - The Times of India
summary:
AB de Villiers offers Virat Kohli key advice

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Following a challenging tour of Australia, AB de Villiers has shared critical advice with his friend Virat Kohli, who faced difficulties in his batting performance, particularly against deliveries outside off-stump, leading to India's loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Kohli struggled with his form in the recent series, scoring only 190 runs over nine innings.
  • His performance included an average of 23.75, with a single century in the first Test.
  • De Villiers highlighted the need for Kohli to reset his mindset and avoid on-field battles during tough times.
  • Kohli's significant challenges in the ongoing 2024-25 Test season were also discussed, where he has only managed 382 runs in 10 matches.
  • De Villiers acknowledged Kohli's fighting spirit but urged him to refocus after every ball.
“...it is best to get rid of those things. As a batter, it is to reset every single and realize every ball is an event and just forget about the bowler.” - AB de Villiers

In conclusion, AB de Villiers believes that a mental reset will be crucial for Kohli to regain his form and contribute effectively to the team.
newTitle: AB de Villiers advises Virat Kohli to reset his mindset after tough Australia tour

title: India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections - The Indian Express
summary:
India lose BGT: How superhuman Jasprit Bumrah was let down by colossal batting failures and dubious selections

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Indian Express

India suffered a 1-3 defeat against Australia in the Border Gavaskar Trophy, mainly due to inconsistent batting performances while Jasprit Bumrah's bowling was exceptional, ending the series with 32 wickets.

  • Bumrah's remarkable performance was overshadowed by India's poor batting average of 24.67 compared to Australia's 28.79.
  • India's batting failures included lack of significant contributions from key players like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal stood out as India's best batter with 391 runs.
  • Questions were raised over team selection, particularly the choice of spinners on a green pitch.
  • Australia made fewer errors, clinching the trophy they hadn't held for eight years.
“It is just a different ball game, a different planet, that Bumrah is playing on compared to everyone else.” - Adam Gilchrist

India's shortcomings both in batting consistency and strategic decisions ultimately led to their defeat in the prestigious Border Gavaskar Trophy series.
newTitle: India loses Border Gavaskar Trophy due to batting failures despite Bumrah's heroics

Pakistan opener Saim Ayub is set to undergo treatment in London for an ankle fracture sustained during a Test match in Cape Town. The decision by the PCB to expedite his treatment comes amid past criticisms of their handling of player injuries.

  • Saim Ayub suffered an ankle injury during the second Test against South Africa.
  • The PCB has sent him to London for immediate specialist treatment instead of waiting for the end of the Test.
  • Assistant coach Azhar Mahood will accompany Ayub on his journey.
  • PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi assured that Ayub will receive care at a top hospital.
  • Ayub is expected to miss six weeks of play, risking his participation in the upcoming Champions Trophy.
"All resources will be used for his treatment." - PCB statement

This incident illustrates the PCB's commitment to improving their approach to player injuries, aiming for a more proactive and immediate response to such situations.

'A bit of theatre': Pat Cummins praises Virat Kohli for adding drama to rivalry

After a victorious match in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy final, Australian captain Pat Cummins commended Virat Kohli for his performances and the dramatic element he brings to their rivalry.

  • Pat Cummins praised Kohli's contributions to the game and noted the excitement his presence brings.

  • Kohli had a challenging series, finishing with 190 runs in nine innings, including one century.

title: Virat Kohli Wants To Play 2027 World Cup, In ‘No Mood To Retire’: Report - News18
summary:
Virat Kohli Aims for 2027 World Cup, Postpones Retirement Plans

Date: January 05, 2025 Source: News18

Virat Kohli is not contemplating retirement despite a challenging year in international cricket. He aims to participate in the 2027 ODI World Cup set to be held in Africa.

  • Kohli had a disappointing 2024, scoring only one century in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Questions arise about his and Rohit Sharma's future in international cricket following poor performances.
  • Selectors may find it difficult to choose Kohli based solely on IPL performances without recent red-ball cricket experience.
  • Kohli last played domestic red-ball cricket in 2012, while Rohit last played in 2015.
  • Head coach Gautam Gambhir indicates it is up to Kohli and Rohit to decide their futures.
“Would be very hard for selectors to pick either Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli on the basis of IPL performance or form.”

In conclusion, although Kohli's recent form raises concerns, his determination to continue playing suggests he is still a key figure for the Indian cricket team moving forward.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Aims for 2027 World Cup, Postpones Retirement Plans

The Indian cricket team suffered a defeat against Australia in the fifth Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, raising questions about the futures of senior players Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli. title: Cricket Australia Breaks Silence On Not Calling Sunil Gavaskar To Present Border-Gavaskar Trophy - NDTV Sports
We need players like Yashasvi Jaiswal, Nitish Reddy who protect their wicket like life: Sunil Gavaskar - The Times of India
summary:
Sunil Gavaskar Calls for Committed Young Players Post India’s Border-Gavaskar Trophy Loss

Publication Date: January 5, 2023

Source: Times of India

Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar analyzed India's recent loss in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, emphasizing the need for players like Yashasvi Jaiswal and Nitish Reddy who show commitment and protect their wicket seriously.

  • Gavaskar suggested that motivated young players are essential for India's cricket future.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal scored a total of 391 runs in five Tests, including a 161 in Perth.
  • Nitish Reddy contributed 298 runs in his debut series with a maiden Test century.
  • Gavaskar questioned player commitment and participation in the upcoming Ranji Trophy matches amidst ongoing T20 series.
  • He stressed India's batting deficiencies and the importance of application in Test cricket.
  • Gavaskar identified technical deficiencies contributing to India's struggles in recent Test series.
  • He called for readiness for the next World Test Championship cycle, starting in June.
“You need such players who will protect their wicket like their life. You need such players.” - Sunil Gavaskar

Gavaskar's insights reveal a call for rejuvenation and commitment within the Indian cricket team as they prepare for future challenges.
newTitle: Sunil Gavaskar Calls for Committed Young Players Post India’s Border-Gavaskar Trophy Loss

title: Stuart Broad’s old ‘Australia start to fight and moan’ comment emerges after Konstas-Bumrah episode reaches fever pitch - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stuart Broad's old comment of ‘Australia start to fight and moan’ is going viral amid the Sam Konstas-Jasprit Bumrah episode in the Sydney Test.

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy series between India and Australia may have concluded with Australia winning 3-1, but the conflict between Sam Konstas and Jasprit Bumrah during the first day at the Sydney Cricket Ground continues to garner attention following sharp remarks from India coach Gautam Gambhir.

  • The incident has escalated with Andrew McDonald accusing India of intimidating Konstas.
  • Bumrah confronted Konstas after he attempted to provoke him before the close of play.
  • Gautam Gambhir suggested that McDonald's claims of intimidation were unfounded.

What did Stuart Broad say?

"Just from the outside, it looks like Australia have started a lot of fights and then [are] moaning when someone comes back." - Stuart Broad

This comment resurfaced during the ongoing controversy, initially stemming from Broad's remarks during a 2018 press conference regarding Australia's behavior in cricket.

The situation reflects ongoing tensions in cricket and the dynamics between players from different teams.
newTitle: Stuart Broad's Viral 'Fight and Moan' Comment Resurfaces Amid Bumrah-Konstas Incident

title: Amid Retirement Claims, Report Says Virat Kohli Wants To Play Till This Tournament | Cricket News - NDTV Sports
summary:
Virat Kohli Aims to Continue Playing Cricket Until the 2027 ODI World Cup

Published on: January 25, 2025 by NDTV

Virat Kohli's cricketing future remains uncertain as he struggles with form, but reports suggest he wants to play until the 2027 ODI World Cup.

  • Kohli's performance during the recent Border-Gavaskar Trophy has raised questions about his Test career.
  • He has played nine innings over five Tests, with disappointing stats aside from a century in Perth.
  • Former coach Ravi Shastri believes Kohli will continue, while others express concerns about his selection for upcoming tours.
  • Kohli may miss county cricket preparation due to IPL commitments and his focus on winning an IPL trophy.
  • There are options for Kohli to play India A games ahead of the senior team's tour in June.
"It would be very hard for selectors to pick either Rohit Sharma or Virat Kohli on the basis of IPL performance or form." - Former national selector

The future of one of cricket's biggest stars hangs in balance, but Kohli's determination to continue playing remains strong.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Aims to Continue Playing Cricket Until the 2027 ODI World Cup
